name: predisposed
content:
be predisposed to/towards something
Add to word list
Add to word list
to be more likely than other people to have a medical condition or to behave in a particular way: Researchers have discovered that the children of these patients are genetically predisposed to cancer. The president is predisposed towards negotiation and favours a peaceful way of resolving the crisis.
